text:
Something gets left out of ADHD & autism discourse AND gifted kid discourse: many gifted kids are non-neurotypical, and some of their useful abilities are connected to their neurodiversity.

Problems later in life come from society's insistence on pathologizing neurodiversity.

text:
Neurodiversity awareness helps a lot in self management. 

For example, I used to read a text and then change to another app, meaning to go back to it, then frustrate because I forgot to reply. 

Now I exit the app knowing I might forget but willing to risk it anyway.

text: @MisWiredKE 2e is rooted in giftedness, not necessarily academics. It's the intersection of giftedness and some form of neurodiversity. You can be gifted and not excel academically, especially if you haven't been accommodated. Gifted underachievement is a real thing.

text: @sallyjpla @Adriana_Edu @SarahKapit @ZrAlexKapitan Also the term neurodivergent was coined 20 years ago by Kassiane Asasumasu, an autistic woman of color who's been a key figure in the neurodiversity movement. text: @Adriana_Edu @sallyjpla But I am pretty firm on saying that no, individuals cannot be neurodiverse. Neurodiversity refers to a political movement. Autistic pride is disability pride. 

Neurodivergent pride is disability pride. 

Cutting ourselves away is to cut us off from our identity, our history, our strength, and the potential in our future. 

Only through disability justice does neurodiversity truly succeed.

text:
If we move away from the idea of neurodiversity as disabiity justice, then we move away from what makes real change, from what works, from what we need, from who we are. 

Separating neurodivergence from disability is not a necessary part of having neurodivergent pride.

text:
The neurodiversity movement is born from the disability justice movement, and we need to be proud of being a part of that movement rather than moving away from it. 

Neurodiversity is disability justice. Autistic pride is disability justice. Our joy is radical disability justice.

text:
@steven_brix My answer is Tabs v. Spaces since there is an accessibility concern. Tabs can be changed to display with different widths to accommodate neurodiversity (spacing information is easier to consume) or low vision (reducing spacing is more magnifier friendly).

Just my opinion though.

text:
@EmbraceASD @BeaconHouseTeam Trauma is a psychological malady caused by others in an act (or acts) of violence, abuse or betrayal(s) of trust. 
To suggest that autism is incorrectly dx trauma is to invalidate the neurodiversity narrative of autism as a natural way being-in-the-world.

text: @EmbraceASD @BeaconHouseTeam Recent research has demonstrated the polygenic origins. This more recent research also validates the neurodiversity movement's claim that autism is a natural part of human diversity, i.e. should not be regarded as a psychological illness.
tokenized_text: <user> <user> recent research has demonstrated the polygenic origins . this more recent research also validates the neurodiversity movement ' s claim that autism is a natural part of human diversity , i . e . should not be regarded as a psychological illness .
